Previously, the Museum of Modern Art has given the artist an annual grant of $500,000 for the cycle. The British Museum (BMI) in London announced today that the institution will soon celebrate its sixtieth anniversary. The announcement follows a yearlong celebration in January 2021 that witnessed a major exhibition of new works by leading artists, including William Shakespeare, Jane Austen, and Franz Kafka.The biennial will be inaugurated with a solo exhibition of work by the British artist Reva Jodi, which will be followed by a major celebration of the centenary of the institution, which will celebrate the milestone with a special exhibition of works by artists who were working in the sixties. The event will also include the launch of the museum’s Digital Museum, a new interactive experience, and a series of events that will present the full range of the British Museum, including tours and talks.The biennial will also feature a new exhibition of work by the American artist Edward Hopper. The show will open on January 8, 2021 and run until February 29, 2021.
